docs.abstract: The opposite is more likely to be true, according to research and experts.
docs.snippet: The opposite is more likely to be true, according to research and experts.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump, in saying that he wanted to reopen the economy by Easter, has argued that an economic downturn would be more deadly than the coronavirus.

headline.main: Trump’s Baseless Claim That a Recession Would Be Deadlier Than the Coronavirus

docs.abstract: The president, who has watched the economy plunge amid social distancing measures, says restrictions will be reassessed.
docs.snippet: The president, who has watched the economy plunge amid social distancing measures, says restrictions will be reassessed.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump on Sunday night said that the government would reassess the recommended period for keeping businesses shut and millions of workers at home after this week, amid millions of job losses caused by the efforts to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

headline.main: Trump Says Coronavirus Cure Cannot ‘Be Worse Than the Problem Itself’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

byline.original: By Maggie Haberman and David E. Sanger

docs.abstract: The president said on a conference call that he had not “heard about testing in weeks.”
docs.snippet: The president said on a conference call that he had not “heard about testing in weeks.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump told governors on a conference call on Monday that he had not “heard about testing in weeks,” suggesting that a chronic lack of kits to screen people for the coronavirus was no longer a problem.

headline.main: Trump Suggests Lack of Testing Is No Longer a Problem. Governors Disagree.
headline.print_headline: Amid Clamor for Test Kits, Trump Sees No Problems

byline.original: By Jonathan Martin, Maggie Haberman and Mike Baker

docs.abstract: The president, facing grim figures from his health advisers, starkly reversed an earlier upbeat assessment that the country could relax the guidelines by Easter.
docs.snippet: The president, facing grim figures from his health advisers, starkly reversed an earlier upbeat assessment that the country could relax the guidelines by Easter.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump retreated Sunday from his desire to relax coronavirus guidelines by Easter, announcing instead that all Americans must continue to avoid nonessential travel, going to work, eating at bars and restaurants, or gathering in groups of more than 10 for at least another month and perhaps until June.

headline.main: Trump Extends Social Distancing Guidelines Through End of April
headline.print_headline: After a Grim Forecast, Trump Extends Limits

docs.abstract: Navy officials insist that they are doing everything short of Saran-wrapping the ship to try to keep it virus-free.
docs.snippet: Navy officials insist that they are doing everything short of Saran-wrapping the ship to try to keep it virus-free.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The enormous hospital ship U.S.N.S. Comfort arrived in New York Harbor Monday morning, a gleaming white beacon of hope for a besieged city as it fights the novel coronavirus.

headline.main: Navy Hospital Ship Reaches New York. But It’s Not Made to Contain Coronavirus.
headline.print_headline: Hospital Ship Drops Anchor, Aiming to Be Coronavirus-Free

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

byline.original: By Helene Cooper and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

docs.abstract: The Defense Production Act has been invoked hundreds of thousands of times in the Trump years. But with the pandemic, the president sees it as a “break the glass” last resort.
docs.snippet: The Defense Production Act has been invoked hundreds of thousands of times in the Trump years. But with the pandemic, the president sees it as a “break the glass” last resort.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Chemicals used to construct military missiles. Materials needed to build drones. Body armor for agents patrolling the southwest border. Equipment for natural disaster response.

headline.main: Wartime Production Law Has Been Used Routinely, but Not With Coronavirus
headline.print_headline: Wartime Law Has Been Used Routinely by Trump

byline.original: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Ana Swanson

docs.abstract: The calls by corporate leaders have intensified as the coronavirus inflicts financial pain, but President Trump has argued that the levies do not hurt American companies.
docs.snippet: The calls by corporate leaders have intensified as the coronavirus inflicts financial pain, but President Trump has argued that the levies do not hurt American companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump continues to resist calls from hundreds of companies to drop tariffs he has placed on foreign goods, arguing that the levies do not impose costs on American companies, despite economic evidence to the contrary.

headline.main: Trump Rebuffs Demands to Lift Tariffs as Economy Falters
headline.print_headline: Trump Resists Calls From Corporate Leaders to Lift Trade Tariffs

docs.abstract: Afghanistan has gone from being the “good war” that the United States must win to the longstanding burden that, like the British, the Soviets and a series of others, it now seeks to unload.
docs.snippet: Afghanistan has gone from being the “good war” that the United States must win to the longstanding burden that, like the British, the Soviets and a series of others, it now seeks to unload.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump has left no doubt that his first priority in Afghanistan is a peace treaty that would enable him to claim that he is fulfilling his vow to withdraw American troops.

headline.main: After 18 Years, Is This Afghan Peace, or Just a Way Out?
headline.print_headline: Will Truce Lead to Lasting Peace? For Trump, It May Not Matter

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: Democrats increasingly regard winning the Senate as their last remaining check on President Trump, should he win re-election, while Republicans fight to maintain power in Congress.
docs.snippet: Democrats increasingly regard winning the Senate as their last remaining check on President Trump, should he win re-election, while Republicans fight to maintain power in Congress.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The 2020 battle for control of the Senate gets underway in earnest Tuesday, with both parties increasingly seeing the chamber as a must-win prize to guard against uncertainty over who will wind up in the White House.

headline.main: Battle for Control of Senate Takes Shape as Both Parties Seek Firewall
headline.print_headline: Battle for the Senate Is Set to Begin, With a Political Firewall at Stake

docs.abstract: Renewed attacks on Afghan forces over the weekend underscored the difficulties of enforcing a peace agreement — and understanding what was happening on the ground.
docs.snippet: Renewed attacks on Afghan forces over the weekend underscored the difficulties of enforcing a peace agreement — and understanding what was happening on the ground.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Defense Secretary Mark T. Esper said on Monday that the United States had begun withdrawing troops from Afghanistan, the first steps in what could be a complete exit from the country within the next 14 months.

headline.main: U.S. Announces Troop Withdrawal in Afghanistan as Respite From Violence Ends
headline.print_headline: U.S. Troop Reduction Begins in Afghanistan
